title: Document public REST API with OpenAPI spec
description:
Generate an OpenAPI/Swagger specification for all public REST API endpoints under app/api/. This covers:

**Endpoints to document:**
- CLI Auth (device flow): POST /api/cli/device/authorize, POST /api/cli/device/token, POST /api/cli/authorize
- Sites CRUD: POST /api/sites, GET /api/sites
- Site sync: POST /api/sites/id/{siteId}/sync, POST /api/sites/id/{siteId}/files, DELETE /api/sites/id/{siteId}/files
- Site status: GET /api/sites/id/{siteId}/status
- Anonymous publish: POST /api/sites/publish-anon, POST /api/sites/claim
- User: GET /api/user
- Tokens: POST /api/tokens/revoke
- Site auth: GET /api/sites/id/{siteId}/login, GET /api/sites/id/{siteId}/logout
- Domain verification: GET /api/domain/{domain}/verify
- Webhooks: POST /api/webhooks/github-app, POST /api/webhook, POST /api/stripe/webhook
- GitHub App: GET /api/github-app/installations, GET /api/github-app/installations/{id}, GET /api/github-app/installation-url, POST /api/github-app/sync-repositories
- Sitemap/robots: GET /api/sitemap/{user}/{project}, GET /api/robots/{hostname}

**Deliverables:**
1. An OpenAPI 3.1 spec file (e.g., docs/openapi.yaml) documenting all REST endpoints
2. Each endpoint should include: method, path, description, auth requirements, request body schema, response schemas, error codes
3. Spec should be validated with an OpenAPI linter

**Approach:**
- Read each route handler in app/api/ to extract request/response types
- Use Zod schemas or TypeScript types where they exist to derive JSON Schema
- Document authentication methods (Bearer token, session cookie, API key)

title: Sidebar scoped to specific site subpaths/subfolders
description:
Allow users to enable a sidebar on specific subpaths of their site rather than globally. For example, a user should be able to show a sidebar only under /docs that lists only the files within the docs folder.

## Use case
A site has mixed content — blog posts, landing pages, docs — and only the /docs section needs sidebar navigation. Currently there's no way to scope the sidebar to a subpath.

## Requirements
- Configure sidebar to appear only on specified subpaths (e.g. /docs, /guides)
- Sidebar content should be auto-generated from the files within that subpath/subfolder
- Multiple independent sidebars for different subpaths (e.g. /docs has one sidebar, /api has another)
- Sidebar should respect folder hierarchy and ordering within the scoped path

## Acceptance criteria
- User can configure a sidebar scoped to a subpath (e.g. /docs)
- Sidebar only renders on pages within that subpath
- Sidebar lists only files/folders under the configured subpath
- Works with nested subfolders within the scoped path

title: Typesense collection not created for CLI/Obsidian/anon publish paths
description:
Sites created or published via CLI, Obsidian plugin, or anonymous publish endpoints use API routes directly (POST /api/sites, POST /api/sites/id/:siteId/files, POST /api/sites/id/:siteId/sync, POST /api/sites/publish-anon) instead of the Inngest syncSite function. The Inngest path creates the Typesense collection before uploading files (inngest/functions.ts:99-104), but none of the API endpoints do. When the Cloudflare worker processes these uploads and tries to upsert documents into Typesense, the collection doesn't exist. The worker silently swallows the error (worker.js indexInTypesense catch block) and marks the blob as SUCCESS anyway, so search never works for these sites.

Fix: Add createSiteCollection() calls to all 4 API endpoints that create or publish sites without going through Inngest.

title: Remove site alias resolution (no longer needed)
description:
## Summary

The site alias resolution system maps canonical site paths (e.g. `/@olayway/blog`) to shorter friendly paths (e.g. `/blog`). This is no longer needed and should be removed.

## Files to modify

### Remove entirely
- `apps/flowershow/lib/resolve-site-alias.ts` — core bidirectional alias resolution function
- `apps/flowershow/lib/resolve-site-alias.test.ts` — unit tests

### Remove alias-related code from
- `apps/flowershow/middleware.ts` (line ~138-140) — remove `resolveSiteAlias(pathname, 'from')` call in root-domain routing
- `apps/flowershow/lib/get-site-url.ts` (lines ~19, 31) — remove `resolveSiteAlias(..., 'to')` calls in URL generation
- `apps/flowershow/app/(public)/site/[user]/[project]/[[...slug]]/page.tsx` (lines ~170-173) — remove alias resolution in redirect URL construction

### Remove type definitions
- `apps/flowershow/components/types.ts` (lines 113-116) — remove `SiteAlias` interface
- `apps/flowershow/components/types.ts` (line 137) — remove `siteAliases?: SiteAlias[]` from `AppConfig`

### Update documentation
- `apps/flowershow/README.md` (line ~308) — remove site aliases reference

## Notes
- The `siteAliases` config was loaded from an external `config.json` on Cloudflare R2; that config entry can also be removed when convenient.
- The resolve function contains a hardcoded bypass for `/@olayway/datahub-cloud-test-repo` which should also go away.

title: [Image v1] Audit image rendering paths and baseline metrics
description: Identify markdown/content image rendering paths, find responsive/fill next/image usages missing sizes, and record baseline LCP + image transfer bytes on representative pages.
acceptance_criteria: Audit note posted with file/route coverage; baseline metrics table recorded; validation pages/components listed.
notes:
## AUDIT FINDINGS - Image Rendering Paths ### Summary **Current state**: Markdown content images are NOT optimized (plain ``). Layout/component images ARE optimized via `next/image`. ### 1. Markdown/Content Image Rendering Path **Pipeline** (`lib/markdown.ts`): 1. Remark plugins process markdown → AST 2. `remarkObsidianImageSize` extracts width/height from Obsidian alt-text syntax 3. `rehypeResolveHtmlUrls` resolves relative paths to absolute URLs 4. `rehypeUnwrapParagraphsAroundMedia` removes `

` wrappers around images 5. Final output: **plain HTML `` tags** (NOT next/image) **Key files**: - `lib/markdown.ts` - MDX processing config - `lib/remark-obsidian-image-size.ts` - Obsidian image sizing - `lib/rehype-resolve-html-urls.ts` - URL resolution - `components/public/mdx/fs-image.tsx` - Image wrapper (optimization DISABLED per #1013) - `components/public/mdx/mdx-components-factory.tsx` - `img` component is COMMENTED OUT **Why disabled**: Issue #1013 - bugs with private sites, HTML+Tailwind, Obsidian sizing. Reverted pending RFC #984. ### 2. next/image Usages (All properly configured) | File | Props | Status | |------|-------|--------| | `components/public/hero.tsx:89-96` | width=1200, height=800, fetchPriority="high" | ✅ | | `components/public/nav.tsx:65-71` | width=32, height=32 | ✅ | | `components/public/layouts/blog.tsx:104-113` | fill=true, sizes="(min-width: 1280px) 1152px, 100vw" | ✅ | | `components/public/mdx/list.tsx:142-151` | width=1200, height=800 | ✅ | | `components/public/mdx/obsidian-base-cards.tsx:268-277` | fill=true, sizes="${cardSize}px" | ✅ | | `components/dashboard/blur-image.tsx` | Forwards all props | ⚠️ Caller dependent | | `components/dashboard/nav.tsx:84` | width=32, height=32 | ✅ | | `components/dashboard/profile.tsx:14-23` | width=40, height=40 | ✅ | | `app/(cloud)/login/page.tsx:17-23` | width=48, height=48 | ✅ | ### 3. Configuration `next.config.mjs`: ```js images: { remotePatterns: [{ hostname: '*' }] } ``` - Allows images from any domain - No custom loader (uses Vercel default) ### 4. Key Issues 1. **Markdown images bypass optimization** - FsImage returns ``, not `` 2. **No srcset/sizes on content images** - Original file always downloaded 3. **Image geometry unknown at render time** - See issue #978 ### 5. Related Issues/PRs - **RFC #984**: Image optimization plan (open PR with `rfcs/image-optimization.md`) - **Issue #978**: Store image geometry at upload time (OPEN) - **Issue #1013**: Disable optimization until edge cases handled (CLOSED - optimization reverted) ### 6. Validation Pages for Metrics Representative pages to test: - Any markdown page with embedded images - Blog post pages with featured images - Obsidian Bases views with card images - Custom landing pages with HTML images ### 7. Baseline Metrics **Cannot measure LCP/transfer bytes without running the site.** Recommend: 1. Run dev server and use Chrome DevTools Lighthouse 2. Or use production URL with PageSpeed Insights **Expected baseline issues**: - Content images: No srcset, full-size downloads regardless of viewport - LCP likely degraded on image-heavy pages
